channel.title: 718 interface help
channel.description:
So i'm trying to make an interface for my teleports and I have it all works good minus the top title of the interface, If i try to change the words it just puts my words inside of the current words, pictures below:
[img]http://i68.tinypic.com/34gkao6.png[/img]
and heres with my words [img]http://i67.tinypic.com/21odap5.png[/img]

item.title: 718 interface help
item.dc:creator: @Futadoll Futadoll
item.description:
@Futadoll wrote:

My guess would be that somewhere, the “choose your motto” is still being sent. Try to look through your code and see if you can find where that is. If you can’t, then it’s a sprite issue.

Read full topic

item.title: 718 interface help
item.dc:creator: @Ansarith Ansarith
item.description:
@Ansarith wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:10, topic:554547”][quote author=Ansarith link=topic=673470.msg4503299#msg4503299 date=1453902767]

The only thing I could think of is you have an id wrong, but your code is showing that it’s not.

Unfortunately, I’m not an expert on the newer servers/clients, so I can’t really be much of help here.

No problem, thank you for trying.
[/quote]
What would happen if you sent the interface after the text?

if (!player.isLocked()) { player.getPackets().sendIComponentText(1312, 27, "Prometheus Teleports"); player.getPackets().sendIComponentText(1312, 38, "Training"); player.getPackets().sendIComponentText(1312, 46, "Skilling"); player.getPackets().sendIComponentText(1312, 54, "Slayer"); player.getPackets().sendIComponentText(1312, 62, "Monsters"); player.getPackets().sendIComponentText(1312, 70, "Bossing"); player.getPackets().sendIComponentText(1312, 78, "Pking"); player.getPackets().sendIComponentText(1312, 86, "Minigames"); player.getPackets().sendIComponentText(1312, 94, ""); player.getPackets().sendIComponentText(1312, 102, ""); player.getInterfaceManager().sendInterface(1312); }
I highly doubt that changes anything, but that’s how it seemed to work in your commands.[/quote]

still the same issue…

Read full topic

item.title: 718 interface help
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Ansarith, post:9, topic:554547”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=673470.msg4503285#msg4503285 date=1453874251]
The only thing I could think of is you have an id wrong, but your code is showing that it’s not.

Unfortunately, I’m not an expert on the newer servers/clients, so I can’t really be much of help here.
[/quote]

No problem, thank you for trying.[/quote]
What would happen if you sent the interface after the text?

if (!player.isLocked()) { player.getPackets().sendIComponentText(1312, 27, "Prometheus Teleports"); player.getPackets().sendIComponentText(1312, 38, "Training"); player.getPackets().sendIComponentText(1312, 46, "Skilling"); player.getPackets().sendIComponentText(1312, 54, "Slayer"); player.getPackets().sendIComponentText(1312, 62, "Monsters"); player.getPackets().sendIComponentText(1312, 70, "Bossing"); player.getPackets().sendIComponentText(1312, 78, "Pking"); player.getPackets().sendIComponentText(1312, 86, "Minigames"); player.getPackets().sendIComponentText(1312, 94, ""); player.getPackets().sendIComponentText(1312, 102, ""); player.getInterfaceManager().sendInterface(1312); }
I highly doubt that changes anything, but that’s how it seemed to work in your commands.

Read full topic

item.title: 718 interface help
item.dc:creator: @Ansarith Ansarith
item.description:
@Ansarith wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:6, topic:554547”]This is going to sound stupid but what’s the code you used for the cid: #?
Because it seems to work there but not when you use the other method.[/quote]

Not stupid just a simple question, the code to show the cid you mean? ;;inters 1312 and then ;;tryinter 1312
below :

case "inters": if (cmd.length < 2) { player.getPackets().sendPanelBoxMessage( "Use: ::inter interfaceId"); return true; } try { int interId = Integer.valueOf(cmd[1]); for (int componentId = 0; componentId < Utils .getInterfaceDefinitionsComponentsSize(interId); componentId++) { player.getPackets().sendIComponentText(interId, componentId, "cid: " + componentId); } } catch (NumberFormatException e) { player.getPackets().sendPanelBoxMessage( "Use: ::inter interfaceId"); } return true; case "tryinter": player.getInterfaceManager().sendInterface(Integer.valueOf(cmd[1])); return true;

Read full topic

item.title: 718 interface help
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

This is going to sound stupid but what’s the code you used for the cid: #?
Because it seems to work there but not when you use the other method.

Read full topic

item.title: 718 interface help
item.dc:creator: @Ansarith Ansarith
item.description:
@Ansarith wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:554547”]Is there a way you can show the interface before the server manipulates it?
(When I say manipulate I mean before it sends the text to it)

The text “Choose Your Motto” seems that it’s being drawn above the id that you replaced with your words, which leads me to believe that the either A) It’s a ‘sprite’ for some reason, and the text is layered underneath it. or B) You’re using the wrong id and the one you are using is still layered under the actual one.[/quote]


Read full topic

item.title: 718 interface help
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Is there a way you can show the interface before the server manipulates it?
(When I say manipulate I mean before it sends the text to it)

The text “Choose Your Motto” seems that it’s being drawn above the id that you replaced with your words, which leads me to believe that the either A) It’s a ‘sprite’ for some reason, and the text is layered underneath it. or B) You’re using the wrong id and the one you are using is still layered under the actual one.

Read full topic

item.title: 718 interface help
item.dc:creator: @Ansarith Ansarith
item.description:
@Ansarith wrote:

sk8rdude461:

Can you provide the code for it?

This is in ObjectHandler

if (id == 1317) { if (!player.isLocked()) { player.getInterfaceManager().sendInterface(1312); player.getPackets().sendIComponentText(1312, 27, "Prometheus Teleports"); player.getPackets().sendIComponentText(1312, 38, "Training"); player.getPackets().sendIComponentText(1312, 46, "Skilling"); player.getPackets().sendIComponentText(1312, 54, "Slayer"); player.getPackets().sendIComponentText(1312, 62, "Monsters"); player.getPackets().sendIComponentText(1312, 70, "Bossing"); player.getPackets().sendIComponentText(1312, 78, "Pking"); player.getPackets().sendIComponentText(1312, 86, "Minigames"); player.getPackets().sendIComponentText(1312, 94, ""); player.getPackets().sendIComponentText(1312, 102, ""); } return; }

And this is in ButtonHandler

} else if (interfaceId == 1312) { if (componentId == 35) player.getDialogueManager().startDialogue("TrainingTeleports"); if (componentId == 43) player.getDialogueManager().startDialogue("SkillingTeleports"); if (componentId == 51) player.getDialogueManager().startDialogue("SlayerTeleports"); if (componentId == 59) player.getDialogueManager().startDialogue("MonsterTeleports"); if (componentId == 67) player.getDialogueManager().startDialogue("BossTeleports"); if (componentId == 75) player.getInterfaceManager().sendInterface(678); if (componentId == 83) player.getDialogueManager().startDialogue("MinigameTeleports"); if (componentId == 91) //player.getPackets().sendGameMessage(""); if (componentId == 99) { //player.getPackets().sendGameMessage(""); }

Read full topic
